title: Check Your Tire Pressure
tip: Check your tire pressure at least once a month. Properly inflated tires improve fuel economy and handling.

title: Listen to Your Brakes
tip: Squealing or grinding noises when braking indicate worn brake pads. Have them inspected promptly.

title: Change Oil Regularly
tip: Regular oil changes are the single most important maintenance item for engine longevity.

title: Check Your Lights
tip: Walk around your car periodically to ensure all lights are working properly - headlights, brake lights, and turn signals.

title: Replace Wiper Blades
tip: Replace wiper blades every 6-12 months for clear visibility in rain and snow.

title: Monitor Coolant Levels
tip: Check your coolant level regularly to prevent overheating. Never open a hot radiator cap.

title: Keep Your Car Clean
tip: Regular washing protects your paint from dirt, salt, and contaminants that can cause rust.

title: Check Battery Terminals
tip: Inspect battery terminals for corrosion. Clean with baking soda and water if needed.

title: Rotate Your Tires
tip: Rotate tires every 5,000-7,500 miles to ensure even wear and extend tire life.

title: Replace Air Filters
tip: A clean air filter improves engine performance and fuel economy. Check it every oil change.

title: Warm Up Your Engine
tip: Let your engine warm up for 30-60 seconds before driving, especially in cold weather.

title: Check Transmission Fluid
tip: Low or dirty transmission fluid can cause shifting problems. Check it according to your owner's manual.

title: Inspect Belts and Hoses
tip: Look for cracks, fraying, or bulges in belts and hoses. Replace them before they fail.

title: Keep Fuel Tank Above Quarter
tip: Keeping your fuel tank above quarter full helps prevent fuel pump wear and moisture buildup.

title: Check Power Steering Fluid
tip: Difficulty steering or unusual noises may indicate low power steering fluid.

title: Test Your Battery
tip: Have your battery tested before winter. Cold weather can reduce battery capacity by 50%.

title: Park in Shade
tip: Parking in shade helps protect your interior from UV damage and keeps the cabin cooler.

title: Use the Right Fuel
tip: Use the fuel grade recommended in your owner's manual. Premium isn't always better.

title: Check Brake Fluid
tip: Brake fluid absorbs moisture over time. Have it flushed every 2-3 years for optimal braking.

title: Inspect Tread Depth
tip: Use the penny test: insert a penny head-first. If you can see all of Lincoln's head, it's time for new tires.

title: Replace Cabin Air Filter
tip: A clean cabin air filter improves A/C performance and interior air quality.

title: Check Wheel Alignment
tip: If your car pulls to one side or the steering wheel is off-center, have your alignment checked.

title: Don't Ignore Warning Lights
tip: Dashboard warning lights indicate potential problems. Have them diagnosed promptly.

title: Keep Records
tip: Maintaining detailed service records helps track maintenance and increases resale value.

title: Check Spare Tire
tip: Don't forget to check your spare tire's pressure. A flat spare won't help in an emergency.

title: Clean Your Headlights
tip: Yellowed or hazy headlights reduce visibility. Use a headlight restoration kit to clear them up.

title: Wax Your Car
tip: Waxing your car every few months protects the paint and makes washing easier.

title: Check Exhaust System
tip: Unusual noises or a drop in fuel economy may indicate exhaust system problems.

title: Replace Timing Belt
tip: If your car has a timing belt, replace it at the recommended interval to prevent engine damage.

title: Lubricate Door Hinges
tip: Apply lubricant to door hinges and locks periodically to prevent squeaking and binding.

title: Check Emergency Kit
tip: Keep an emergency kit in your car with jumper cables, flashlight, first aid supplies, and water.

title: Drive Smoothly
tip: Smooth acceleration and braking reduce wear on your vehicle and improve fuel economy.

title: Avoid Short Trips
tip: Short trips don't allow the engine to reach optimal temperature, which can cause moisture buildup.

title: Check Suspension
tip: Bouncy ride or uneven tire wear may indicate worn shocks or struts. Have them inspected.

title: Protect Your Interior
tip: Use sunshades and seat covers to protect your interior from sun damage and wear.
